description: APPLICATION FOR PRIOR APPROVAL IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION WITH A DEPTH OF 6M, MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF 3M AND EAVES HEIGHT OF 3M.
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - Under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval would be required and REFUSED for the following reason:

By reason of insufficient drawings detailing the extent of natural ground level, the scheme fails to comply with criteria A.4(3)(b) of Class A Part 1 Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).  This is because Officers cannot make a determination as to whether the proposed single storey rear extension would comply with the provisions of the conditions, limitations or restrictions application to development permitted by Class A which exceeds the limits in paragraph A1(f) but is allowed by paragraph A.1(g) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended). 

Reason : 2 - Under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), prior approval would be required and REFUSED for the following reason:

The proposed development, by reason of its combined height, proximity to the boundary and juxtaposition with the neighbouring property, would result in a visually intrusive and overbearing form of development that would cause potential loss of light and create unreasonable sense of enclosure to the rear windows and garden areas of nearby occupants, in particular, no. 309 Lynmouth Avenue, in conflict with, in particular, Policy D12.3 of Merton Local Plan 2024.
